website_summaries.verdict: Sony's WF-1000XM3 true wireless earphones deliver excellent noise cancellation and strong audio performance, tempered by some easily avoidable shortcomings.
pros: Strong audio performance, with adjustable EQ
cons: On-ear controls can be a pain to operate

customer_reviews.title: I loved this device and used it for many hours each day, UNTIL it melted and almost caught FIRE.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this device and used it for many hours each day, UNTIL it melted and almost caught FIRE. See the attached photo. The cable melted, the metal connector deformed, a toxic-like smell was release. The entire device was too hot to touch. I believe if it was left any longer it would have cause fire. Context: The device was connected to a standard IKEA charger with a standard cable. Both have been used on with many other devices without any trouble. There were no environmental factors: no direct sunlight, ambient temp was less then 25oC, the device was not covered and not near any other devices. UPDATE: I re-ordered the earphones. The replacement has been fine so far
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: They look good and fit well but the sound quality is very disappointing and the noise cancellation seems non existent. I switched from Bose in ear noise cancelling headphones and I really wish I hadn’t. The Sony app can adjust the noise cancelling but it really doesn’t seem to make much difference (I’m currently sat on a train and can hear a guy tapping away on his keyboard while I listen to an audiobook). Maybe I’m doing something wrong but I really wouldn’t recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mikejsinclair

customer_reviews.title: Disapointing
customer_reviews.text: Super complex to install the sound quality has nothing special and the management of the functionalities is difficult. Really disapointing. The noise reduction is not at all as advertised even at highest levels. Switching from 1 device to another requires complete Bluetooth de- and re-connection. Decided to return them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Dechamps

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling hardy works
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancelling hardly works. The app is confusing and I spent weeks adjusting the "ambient sound" and other settings thinking it was me, but I can't get anything more than minimal noise cancelling. I was looking for a wireless replacement for my Bose QC-20's. These have brilliant noise cancelling and a simple "on-off" switch for noise cancelling. With noise cancelling on you really feel isolated from your surroundings. Not with these Sony headphones. I had read many expert reviews and wonder whether they had been reviewing the same headphones. Sound quality is great, but I paid for a pair of noise cancelling headphones which these aren't. I returned them for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Woolley

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Wireless earbuds have finally arrived, the sound is a step above anything in the True wireless form, battery life is brilliant, and the charging case just adds to the quality feel. These are the ones. Gripes... just niggles really i prefer the previous incarnations ear buds that hold inside the ear these feel like they are going to fall out and therefore wont be going for a jog or gym session, and the lack of volume control. All is forgiven though with the sound quality which is just superb run with my Sony Walkman.
customer_reviews.author: B. G. Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended For Sound Quality A Premium Product
customer_reviews.text: I am comparing these to the Sennheiser Momentum Tw. The Sony Connect App is far superior to that from Sennheiser having a 5 band graphic equaliser to tune the sound to your preference. DSSE HX upscales music from 16 Bit 44.1 KHz to 24 Bit 96 KHz. Overall the sound is considerably better than that from the Sennheiser’s more detailed sounding more musical with a better defined bass. I consider these to be good value and would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: hammonda1

customer_reviews.title: These don't stay in my ears properly
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good and the noise cancellation is good, but I can't get these to stay in my ears. I have tried the different size buds. They just don't stay put. :-( It is OK when I am sitting still or when I have a hat on holding them in place, but when I walk, they just bounce out of place and then I don't have a good seal and hear too much outside noise, and I am afraid they will fall out completely.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit. Wouldn’t stay in.
customer_reviews.text: Despite trying the various ear tips that were included and some of my own I just couldn’t get these to stay in my ears. When they stayed in the sound quality was good and the noise cancelling very good. One drawback was you couldn’t control the volume directly from the buds you have to use your mobile or tablet. If these buds fitted then despite the lack of volume control I’d have not returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Gareth M

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality second to none! Not multipurpose earphones and quite large
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is excellent as is the noise cancelling! Would have given 5 stars but definitely not designed for working out. The fit is challenging to get right and they are larger than some of the competitors! For this reason I think they stick out and can get noisy in the wind! If sound quality is is your priority these are for you! If multipurpose earphones is what you’re after then maybe the jabra or AirPods Pro would suit better!
customer_reviews.author: R1978

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable and terrible bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Sound from these is decent but only when you can get them to fit properly which is a complete hassle with these. No matter which sleeve i tried i just couldn't get a decent fit, which meant that they felt awkward to wear as if they were about to fall out. Also the noise cancelling is ridiculous. Its meant to be electronically controlled and adapts to ambient sound but it just doesn't do anything. Finally bluetooth is awful - connection keeps dropping all the time especially if these are used to take telephone call as well as listen to music.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Melville

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: these are great but this may just be my ears but they don't seem to be as loud as my old headphones still great tho. PROS .Great battery life .Very comfortable fell asleep multiple times with them in no discomfort .Great Bluetooth connection range .Crystal clear mic sound on calls .Good depth of sound Note: some people are saying in there reviews you can't change the volume of the music with the headphones you have to use the device you are connected too this is false you have to change the function of the headphones touch features through the app that is provided.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love these earphones, the sound is just phenomenal - but there are some pros and cons as below: Pros: Size and fit of the ear piece; battery capacity; quality of the music (pristine!); customization of the earphones, equalizer options; look and feel of the overall product. Cons: call quality (I can hear fine, person on other end can hear every single ambient noise around me, traffic, people talking etc - Sony have said this is normal and expected behavior - it means the call function is pretty much useless in any setting that has any noise). Initial set up is fussy and not as easy as I hoped. the case is a little on the chunky side.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Good: It look good, premium quality. The noise cancellation is really good as wireless headphones. The sound quality is good but for music only. Bad: The right one doesn't turn itself off half of the time after taken off. The right one can't connect to the phone sometimes, even full charged. The sound quality is really bad when making call. The other end can't hear me properly. Verdict: The price is a bit steep to use it for music only.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited when bought those ones. And even if the noise cancels works just ok, Isn’t very worth that amount of money. But the big downstairs is the microphone, during calls you just have to put them away as the people I spoke to over the phone wasn’t able to hear me at all, they all said my voice was to low. Test them on a call where I was hearing someone else talking from it and it actually was almond impossible hear anyway if not just street noises. Not worth that amount of money and returned
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buds ruined by un-user friendly experience and too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised these are so highly rated. All the sound quality and noise cancelling can't detect from some glaring issues for me. Pro's superb sound quality Great noise cancelling Solid Bluetooth connection Cons Battery life is average at best Large charging case Buds can easily fall out your ear if you put your head on the side regardless of how long you spend messing with tips or screwing it into your ear Controls are terriblely designed. You can choose 2 of 5 options. Volume control/playback/anc/Google assistant/assistant Zero waterproof or dustproofing Do yourself a favour and get the jabra elite 75t they are easily comparable or better in every area
customer_reviews.author: Banana Tumor

customer_reviews.title: Avoid. Bricked themselves on first setup.
customer_reviews.text: Awful experience. Avoid. Downloaded app for headphones. Units connected to iPhone, started an auto update of software. Software update failed for right ear plug halfway through with units sat right next to phone. Now unit seems bricked. Can’t use them. Left earplug attempts to work on its own but only manages a stuttering noise cutting out a few times every second. No idea how to reset or reconnect right unit, phone or app won’t see it. Absolutely can not be bothered to go through tech support channels for this. Return already started. I have 20 quid ear buds that haven’t given me this issue I’m not tolerating it from £200 products on first setup. Summary - Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: MR P J MAY

customer_reviews.title: Who knew earbuds could be so good!
customer_reviews.text: I waited until I had managed to solve the seal issue. Like other reviewers mentioned you have to try a few of the ear tips to find what is best for you. The rubber ones make my ears sore. The bigger foam ones are the best for the seal. I twist the bud a full 180 degrees to make the seal and BINGO, fabulous sound without deafening yourself. It is a revelation to hear the radio without annoying tannoy train noise interfering. Bl00dy marvellous things and fully worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: alivi5

customer_reviews.title: Best in class for noise canceling
customer_reviews.text: Definitely deserve 5 stars for noise canceling. I work in loud manufacturing environments where it is safe to use headphones. God they're good. Of cours whit other headphones can turn volume so high it will blok other sound out but with this I don't have to. When I read negative reviews I can partly agree, odd signal statter, slightly, bulky and not water resistant ( place for improvement ) Sound quality is very good but not very best. Fits well in my ear and not falling out but probably not for running. If you looking for noise canceling this are absolut best but if you don't need noise canceling then look somewhere else
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: “These ARE the droids you’re looking for...”
customer_reviews.text: It’s like Sony made these earbuds to make love to your ears. The sounds is out of this world, when you take them out, suddenly listening to the real world becomes a let down... The are clear, crisp and with amazing deep bass and sound stage. I almost don’t bother with my (expansive) hifi anymore, these are better and don’t annoy the neighbours. The battery life is amazing and the case hasn’t needing charging in days. Google them and you’ll see they’ve won just about every award going. Get a protective cover for the case to keep it nice, some good ones out there for cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Falsely advertised and Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Terrible terrible product. Do not buy. Overpriced garbage. You will be paying for earache, decent sound, awkward and clunky design and an overall a misleading and falsely advertised product. I notice no sound cancellation other than the fact that you are shoving these things deep into your ear. They are basically expensive ear defenders, but more uncomfortable. No idea why people are enjoying these. But to me they are awful. I have used them for two days. And I can't keep them in for more than 25 mins. Sending them back. Save your money from this overexpensive branded garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I tried several of the cheaper alternatives and returned every one, the sound quality wasnt good or they simply stopped working after a few weeks. I was very reluctant to spend this much money on a set of earbuds but took the plunge and am not disappointed. I use them on a farm while in tractors or out in the yard. Quite often they are in a dusty environment and have stood upto not being treated well. They stay in the ear with no problems, the sound quality is excellent, I use them a lot for voice calls and am impressed. Still figuring out google assistant and other fuctions but getting there. I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have the over ear WH model headphones and they are truly amazing. Having to work during lockdown I needed some in-ear buds to walk around with and these were always going to be my first port of call. Firstly, the sound is superb. I’m no expert but they handle the high and low ends very well and although I don’t find really heavy bass is that special, everything else is great. Getting used to the touch control took some time but eventually becomes intuitive. The only thing g I don’t like quite so much are the very short USB lead and the case which doesn’t stand up which is a little irritating.
customer_reviews.author: David T

customer_reviews.title: Look great, but sound is lacking
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - Look fantastic - The sound is crisp and clear - Noise Cancellation is some of the best I've experienced - Fairly comfortable to wear compared to some other in-ears I've worn CONS: - Not enough volume from a £200 set of Sony earbuds. - There is simply no punch from these headphones. The bass is seriously lacking. My £20 Anker wireless buds honestly produce better bass than these. - Unless you're sitting still wearing these, they tend to move about a bit whilst walking, needing constant adjustment I've returned these and gone with my tried and trusted Jabra Elite Sport buds. Same price, but include wing tips for stability and produce a MUCH better sound.
customer_reviews.author: Charles F.

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best, super sleek, super minimal, super sound!
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps some of the best quality of 'sound' through these earphones. Phone calls are just 'ok' - You can here the other person really well however they'll be listening to all the noise around you too so if you're in the office using these and on the phone it may be hard for you to get your message across especially if you work in a loud environment! Never the less, the sound quality is incredible and worth every penny. Battery life is ridiculously amazing. I charge these maybe once every 1-2 weeks! and it's fully charged within 2-3 hours easily. Nothing but positive feedback for this item!
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: I was so disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed with these, I have the headphones version and have to say they have the best sound I have ever heard on headphones so assumed the earbuds would be quality, they were not, they lacked volume and bass, I played with these for hours , even asked my wife to listen .. she said they were bad, it just doesn’t make sense because they have rave reviews, maybe the different size buds were the issue , I tried them all trying to convince myself they were great ... they were not .. awful sound for a premium set of earbuds , not in the same league as it’s big brother the headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Dee

customer_reviews.title: 1 Disappointed Star
customer_reviews.text: I must be the only one that dislikes this headphones. I don't get all the hype about them tbh. First of all Sony has a good selection for ear buds but none of them fits properly. Second of all they move and slide around in your ear like crazy. I have to keep pushing them back in. My sister test them as well and same thing happened. Third reason is the volume. Way to low and lacks so much comparing with Bose headphones. The noise cancelling is ok but even with that on i can hear the traffic around me. From my point of view i don't get the hype and they don't compare with Bose headphones.
customer_reviews.author: figuranta

customer_reviews.title: Much much better than Apples EarPod Pros
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones as I travel on London Underground every day and the noise on the train in the tunnel is deafening. My girlfriend has the new Apple noise cancelling headphones and the noise cancellation is no where near as good. These headphones are a little bulkier, and the case is too, but it’s well worth it for the battery life alone! I’ve never had Bluetooth headphones like it. The charging case holds so much power honestly I didn’t have to charge it for a month! Very impressed would highly recommend to anyone, and such a great price compared to their apple counterpart.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These are completely overrated. I watched YouTube reviews and researched them. In a quiet room the sound quality is very good. But unlike jabra 65t you seem to need both buds in at same time. This is an awful design fault. Connection to an iPhone XS Max. Was initially very simple. However once I tried to pair them with my iPad. Then reconnect to iPhone then take a phone call these buds had a mental break down. I had to uninstall and reinstall them over and over. Loudness is a massive issue. I thought the volume on such an expensive pair should have been much better.
customer_reviews.author: raggy222

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, wont stay in ears.
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound, good noise cancellation, love the compact charge and storage unit. But the damn things will not stay in your ears, no matter what size ear rubber buds you use. I have worn ear buds and earpieces for years professionally so it isn't my ear size, it is down to the portion of the unit outside the ear being too bulky/heavy. I wear noise cancelling headphones/earbuds when travelling on airplanes (44 journeys 2019) and sleep with music playing, I have had to go back to over ear units as these ear buds will not stay in even when just seated on the plane. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: James Jones

customer_reviews.title: Greatest headset I had
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, great noise cancelling. Battery runs out a bit fast but the case recharges them so not that important. Latest software update ruined the connection and touch sensitivity a bit but there is a new update pending right now, so having a new update this fast means they fixed it(I hope :)). If you want a small, easy to carry headset with perfect sound quality, you've found it :)
customer_reviews.author: telin.s

customer_reviews.title: Look good, sound good...when they're actually working!
customer_reviews.text: These Sony WF-1000XM3 headphones are well made, look and sound good, but awful to live with! The noice cancelling is good, but its continually dropping in and out. Grrrr! It's just hard work constantly trying to get them reconnected to me iPhone via bluetooth and the app is infuriating! Any Sony software update creates a new wave of time consuming, faffing about that makes me regret buying these damned things!! And they're really expensive for something that doesn't work properly.
customer_reviews.author: C. Leah

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: To keep it short and simple, these headphones are incredible. Has given me a new appreciation for music. I've been going through my entire catalogue of music testing the audio with these headphones, and my holy moly, the audio sounds so clean and crisp, bass is clear with no distortion and the headphones can pick up every bit of instrumentation and background vocals. It does it in a way where it feels atmospheric, as if you're listening in the studio. They're absolutely brilliant. They're expensive, but you've gotta spend to get the quality, and these deliver on all aspects.
customer_reviews.author: HSN

customer_reviews.title: I’m sticking to normal earphones
customer_reviews.text: I hoped these would be the ones!! After trying what has felt like every pair of Bluetooth earphones I was ready for these to be the ones.... they sounded great and fitted well but the Bluetooth connection was so bad the I had to hold my phone close to my face so they wouldn’t cut out ..... also couldn’t really work out how to use niose cancelling. I’m just sticking to normal earphones because the technology is just not there yet as far as I’m concerned
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. A. Nevill

customer_reviews.title: Quality noise cancelling earphones.
customer_reviews.text: These are really well made good quality earphones as they should be for the high price being asked. They fit snuggly and conformably in the ear. The sound quality is excellent with really good noise cancellation. The battery life is excellent also. The accompanying app is great which allows you to configure them as you like and allows you to change what the touch controls. Overall these are well worth the money for someone who needs high quality earphones with noise cancellation.
customer_reviews.author: Jonno

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love these buds! Wireless buds don't normally sit well in my ears but these do! The noise cancelling is not as good as its bigger head phone brother BUT it blocks out more than enough. Sounds amazing! Look amazing and the hinge in the case is so satisfying even with the cheapo silicone case (not included even at this price point but what ever it's like £8....) If your on the fence as to buy or not I would buy again, the battery life is ace! Being able to use the right bud while the left is charging and then alternate gives these buds a long days use! But that hinge is so satisfying. Did I mention the hinge?
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound but poor design and fit
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones with great ANC but I just couldn't get them to fit or stay in my ears. I tried a multitude of tips, including Comply ones but they just weren't comfortable over extended periods of time or they would just fall out after the slightest bit of movement (especially when moving, eating or talking). I did try running with them as well but they're completely hopeless for that purpose; I was constantly worried they'd end up falling out. Also, the charging case is pretty bulky for portable earphones and don't have a flat base you always have to lay it flat or upside down. Shame as they do sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Shao

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Updated 07/04/2020: Had these about 2 months. Still working perfectly, still really happy with them. Have had these 3/4 days now and so far they're awesome. The sound quality going from a cheap pair of earphones to these is impressive. The noise cancelling is really quite something and cuts out ALOT. I've seen reviews saying they fall out a lot but i guess its down to the individuals ear shape. So far they've stayed in fine including walking round at work and at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Crummett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little things
customer_reviews.text: They're really good for the price. Sound quality wise it's just what you would expect from Sony. I personally don't really use the noise cancelling option so I can't tell my opinion on that. They connect very well for me with everything: phone, tablet, PC, TV (I saw other people got problems with the connectivity). The new controls added for volume actually work well in case you were worried about that. They can be a bit slippery after a while if your ears get a bit sweaty. Overall a great piece of audio device.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Rosca

customer_reviews.title: Not really good value for this price
customer_reviews.text: So I've order those to replace my current headphones which are SoundPEATS TrueFree. Current price is £26.99 . In order to get something ''WAY" better, after a small research I decided to buy those ones. But apparently I could not find a big difference in them. Sony's sound was slightly clear and I could hear depth. But again, small difference between both of them. Even though the bass and Max Volume of SoundPEATS TrueFree was better. And if we consider that there is £120 difference in the prices and I compare them..
customer_reviews.author: Pavlin Alexandrov

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality, struggling to find a comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality, simple enough to use and seem solidly well made. Unfortunately, although one ear is perfectly fine, I struggle to get the other fitted comfortably. It seems to press against the harder parts of my ear no matter which tip I use or how I twist it. . Presumably this is just down to the individual shape of a person's ears, but it does limit how long I can wear them for, which is a shame. I debated long and hard between these and a pair of Sony over-ear 'phones and if I'm honest, if I had my time again I'd probably choose the latter.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Good earphones
customer_reviews.text: These are good, I had purchased some Apple AirPods Pro, but they got returned! The AirPods would not stay in my ears! The rubber tips are way too soft and they just fall out with the slightest of movement! These Sony earphones stay put! I’ve had no issue with these falling out, much better fit! AirPods have better sound! These are good but not as good. AirPods have better Bluetooth confection! These tend to break up quite a lot! But they do stay in my ears!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb, punchy, flexible, fully functional true wireless IEM’s.
customer_reviews.text: Impressive, Most impressive! Or in the words of our lord and saviour Emperor Palpatine... “Goooood, Good.” In all seriousness though these have exceeded my expectations and then some. My ears shall never be embarrassed by the likes of Apple AirPods again! ( This coming from an Apple Fanboy. I kid you not ) I own wireless in ears from Audeze, Bang & Olufsen & these are Better in every way almost. The Audeze’s have a slight edge in audio quality. but not by much!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this product would blow me away after seeing doing extensive research and reading youtube reviews and webpage reviews. Unfortunately, I do not think the sound quality was particularly impressive. It was certainly good and way above average but at this price point I was expecting a lot more. It stayed in fine and was comfortable but due to it being on the heavier side I think I would be wary of it falling out especially because I'm a commuter in London, constantly on the tube and busy sidewalks. It would also be used to do sports such as climbing and it would be a pain if it fell out. Unfortunately will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: adf

customer_reviews.title: Not for the gym
customer_reviews.text: I have given 3 stars purely because they are awful to wear in the gym or when running. I am constantly pushing them back in my ears, but when I have my hands full (when in the gym) they fall out! The sound quality is amazing, the best I’ve ever experienced. The capability is limited, as you can’t adjust the volume, skips songs, etc... you need to do this on your phone / device. So, if you want an earphone with amazing sound quality but with limited tech / capabilities, these are great. If you want an earphone that doesn’t move or fall out when exercising them don’t buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Prezzo

customer_reviews.title: Good with one MAJOR FLAW!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Build quality and sound quality is good. But there is a major flaw in the noise cancellation. Basically, you cannot use these to have a phone conversation because the person you are calling will not be able to hear you. Instead, they will hear all the ambient noise around you instead of your voice. Rendering it useless. There have been a lot of complaints similar to this. Sony have still not been able to fix the problem with software updates so it would appear to be a hardware fault. Such a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Yiu Kong

customer_reviews.title: Keep falling out
customer_reviews.text: These have a very long battery life, the sound quality is very good. But they will not stay in my ears especially the left hand one, I have tried all the combinations of the silicone / foam attachment It seems to me the pice that goes in to the ear needs to be longer, I definitely could not where them whilst running, I would loose them. They work well with Spotify on my I phone but not very well with my smart LG TV.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Slater

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I listen to hours and hours of music a week. Bought these when I subscribed to Amazon Music HD as I wanted some in ear headphones that would reflect the high streaming quality. They are really great headphones. Get them snug with the correct fitting covers (lots come bundled with the headphones) and enjoy. I'm not going to bore you with What HiFi typre reviewing but take it from me, I like good sound quality as music is no 1 on my daily enjoyment and these headphones deliver. I thought carefully as £150 plus is a lot to spend on in ear headphones, but I'm sure glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Dez Rogers

customer_reviews.title: So nearly there...
customer_reviews.text: The reviews on sound quality are all correct noise cancelling is very good. However for the price I can’t justify the frequent irregular pops and dropouts when the phone is stable on my desk within 1m. Tried with other sources and seemed to be better but with the most current iPhone I’m afraid they are getting returned. This was after all firmware updates to all items. Shame
customer_reviews.author: River__s

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, poor fit.
customer_reviews.text: I own the over ear versions so was looking forward to something I could use when in a more active state (light walking) or audio books whilst laying down. The sound of the headphones is good, noise cancelling is ok for what they are, but the fit...the damned fit is unquestionably challenging. They are loose no matter what. It was like the were jumping out of my ears. Really did want to love them but looks like I need to go apple
customer_reviews.author: Gazza

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life!
customer_reviews.text: Read the small print in terms of battery life. I never got more than 5 hours max, if set to economy mode. When Sony state the maximum battery life is 18 hours, that's including the battery built into the charging case. You can't use the earphones when they are in the charging. Also the battery in the right side would always run out half hour before the left, so on the way home sometimes you would just be listening to the left channel. Not very good really after paying £169.99, that's why I returned these. I'll stick to my Sony wired headphones thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Mr White

customer_reviews.title: Wont stay in your ears
customer_reviews.text: Good sound and easy connectivity with most devices (apart from iPhone) and most of all they will not stay in your ears and that makes them completely useless to me as I travel quite a lot and these are not fit for purpose when it comes to traveling. You only have to turn your head and they pop out. So these are jottered in favor of something that keeps hold of the things when they decide to leave your ears...
customer_reviews.author: James Fairfield

customer_reviews.title: There are better petter products
customer_reviews.text: PROS: 1) fit well in ear unless you shake the go for or running. 2) good sound 3) good battery supply 4) good range CONS: 1) expensive for built in features which are puny, requires serious firmware update 2) Cab be connected to only one BT device at the time 3) bad control system, it has sensor butttons instead click button Overall: Jabra elite provides far better functionalities than this head set. Disappointing regarding the price
customer_reviews.author: Biomed Systems

customer_reviews.title: How They Sound & Noise Cancellation
customer_reviews.text: These sound really good and the noise cancellation is adequate. Connecting to an Android device is a breeze. However, I have these and the big brother WH version (over the ears) and both these pair but do not play in Windows 10 on my PC. This, I strongly believe is a Windows 10 problem. Having said all that these headphones offer stunning performance and are very tweakable using the Android app.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Tuck

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have spent too much time and money looking for ‘the’ headphones that are right for me, Ive found them. These are fantastic. I have read reviews, tried many and now finally am hugely satisfied with this purchase. For some reason I don’t have easy ears to fit earbuds too, which has excluded me from many types, even the new apple type, these are great at that too. The sound if excellent, as are most of the features on the app. Not cheap, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Smith

customer_reviews.title: If I lose these, I'll buy them again the same day!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding earbuds! I always have the noise cancelling on, I can happily wander around town or a supermarket and (with music playing) not take part in the life around me! I can see people's mouths moving, people bustling about but can't hear any of it. Beautiful. Apparently a great way to test any new earbuds /headphones is to play Bohemian Rhapsody, it's got all the bass and treble you need in one song. It passed that test easily and Mozart sounds stupendous. Expensive but so so worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: MR M TURNER

customer_reviews.title: Generally good sound
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Good sound. Good built quality. Easy to connect. Reasonable volume Dislikes: Noise in the wind. Looses connection in busy streets/stations. Battery life on continuous use with flak files around 4.5 hrs not 6 or more. When taken off they are supposed to turn off but it seems they continue to consume battery. Comment:I got good isolation with comply foam tips, with secure fit. Adding anc helps a little more.
customer_reviews.author: ab

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, nose cancelling grates
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality and a comfortable fit. It's good that the ear pieces can be used singly but the nose cancelling is a disappointment. After using over-ear Sony headphones, I found there's just too much noise getting through to buy these ear buds for that attribute alone. Buy them for the quality of the sound they make and the cost is justified.
customer_reviews.author: RussEU

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding earphones but sporadically disconnects from my laptop
customer_reviews.text: These earphones have a great sound stage and are relatively comfortable to keep on for several hours at a time. Battery life is great as well and the charging case can provide 2 more full charges before needing to be plugged back in. My only gripe which prevents me from giving it 5 stars is that it sporadically disconnects itself from my laptop which is annoying when I am in a meeting. It rarely happens when it's connected to my phone though.
customer_reviews.author: Japes

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality but noise cancelling not up to the hype IMO
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good however I had bought these with the hope of blocking out bus noise and office background noise. If anything the bus noise is worse, the noise cancelling turns the noise in to a whistle. The battery lasts very well and they’re comfortable to wear if a little bulky. May have to try Bose next as I’m reading that their noise cancelling is exceptional. I’ve also found pairing to a second devise tricky and I use 4 devises so this is what has meant I will be returning mine.
customer_reviews.author: Hadderss

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic build quality and found the use of the app etc very easy. Sound quality is very good although the noise cancelling is not as good as the independent reviews had me believe. My biggest gripe is the fact that they don’t stay put. I’ve tried virtually all of the buds supplied and any physical activity they fall out. I have reverted to my old ones for the gym which cost £50! Unfortunately these are not as good as the reviews would have you believe. Going to try and find other buds to see if they will work
customer_reviews.author: N. Davis

customer_reviews.title: A very disappointing purchase despite being excited about the
customer_reviews.text: Good noise cancellation and the earpiece itself isn’t as large as I thought, but that’s about it. The case is enormous and really inconvenient to carry around in my pocket. The sound quality was also disappointing: the sound would glitch as if it couldn’t maintain a good enough connection - I tried different settings and resetting everything as per advice but nothing worked. Controls are also very difficult to use and I found myself using my phone a lot more than I would have liked to.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Y.

customer_reviews.title: Best from the best. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I tried a lot of headphones in same category but I have to say that these are the best. I required noise canceling Headphones as I travel a lot. In the train you didn't hear almost anything, in the plane is reduction about 95%, so its give you more space for relax during travelling. They are also brilliant in open space offices and helps me to concentrate on my work even better. + noise Canceling + sound quality + battery - missing application for windows - missing option to lover microphone sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Popov

customer_reviews.title: It won't stay in your ear
customer_reviews.text: They make £220 earphones with noise-cancelling, and then put 0.000001p silicone tips on them and that's supposed to hold £110 in each ear. It doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: The Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, doesn't connect to anything without an App...
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use via the App and work great for phone related things like Alexa, youtube, video chats and phone calls. However I have been unable to connect them to my kindle or my PC. Which is a shame because I had hoped to be able to use them for Zoom calls etc. via the PC. You're supposed to press the holes for 7 seconds to pair them, but that doesn't seem to do anything when I do it! Relatively comfortable have used them indoors and whilst walking (and not lost one yet - but it's always a worry!) Pretty good sound quality compared to cheaper brands, but I'm no expert.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant noise reduction and controls
customer_reviews.text: Having switched from a pair of wired Sony headphones to a pair of sony ch700n on-ear headphones,I soon realised that they weren't for me. The key difference is that on-ear headphones are nowhere near as loud as ear buds. They also have poor noise reduction... so I sold them and purchased these WF-1000XM3 in-ear wireless earbuds. These really do tick all the boxes for me. Wireless, in-ear with a good fit, basic pause and volume controls on the buds themselves, but most importantly, the wind noise reduction really works, which is crucial for outdoor use.
customer_reviews.author: magnanimous

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great
customer_reviews.text: I wear these 6 days out of 7, the Bluetooth signal drops out, I’m still trying to figure out if it’s my phone or headphones. Other than that they sound good, you do get a lot of wind noise but that’s tolerable. All in all a good product.
customer_reviews.author: S Danger

customer_reviews.title: Bad call quality
customer_reviews.text: These are good for listening to music and that is about it... Call quality, assistant interaction are horrible and removed the purpose of having a wireless headset.
customer_reviews.author: George Kouzmov

customer_reviews.title: Break Up Sound Using Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these only yesterday and am returning them right away. I connected them to my bluetooth using already installed Sony Connections App on both my iPhone 11 and 8 Plus. On both phones there was intermittent clipping sounds on all the music I played. The App was already there as I have other Sony headphones and bluetooth works just fine on them. Not these though. I uninstalled my app on both phones and updated the software to no avail. Am returning them today. They sounded good, but even then there was a slight up and down and wavering in and out of sound volume. I would not recommend, even at the lower price of £194 I paid.
customer_reviews.author: boozercruiser

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money for my use case
customer_reviews.text: I listen to audio books on the tube and with regular passive ear buds I have to give up when the tube goes underground. I hoped these would solve that... They didn't. Audio in general is fantastic, music sounds great and the charge lasts for ages but ANC is just not effective on my tube line when underground. For this price I can't accept such a huge failing.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant sounding earphones
customer_reviews.text: I was incredibly surprised by the quality of the sound of these earphones. I’ve bought some extremely expensive and highly rated earphones in my time - top of the range Shures among them - but these are easily as good if not better. They are also very comfortable, and really easy to put on and to store safely, with the lovely magnetic case that goes with them. The noise cancelling is good too, and all in all they’re an unbelievably good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Otter

customer_reviews.title: Not very discrete, and always fall out. Connection unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation was pretty good. The sound quality was what I’d expected for the price and the app that can be utilised in conjunction with the wireless headphones can give you a lot of sound options to play with. HOWEVER, the connection the headphones have to your device will often be lost which results in you having to reconnect the headphones which is a tedious process. And the headphones WILL fall out of your ears constantly. If you move your head in any direction instead of looking straight ahead, they will fall out.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great regards the price
customer_reviews.text: Good Bluetooth but not great for cancelling sounds Less than I expected I would recommand a full headset rather than Bluetooth So nice box to charge and use on small bag and still cancel a huge part of sounds in train and plane
customer_reviews.author: Cécile

customer_reviews.title: Unusable; product returned.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t understand how these headphones are so highly reviewed. I returned mine after a couple of weeks for the following reasons 1. They are not comfortable to wear 2. They are too fiddly 3. The case is heavy 4. The battery life is rubbish Compared to AirPods, these are far, far inferior.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Best iPhone / Android ear buds ever
customer_reviews.text: But beware couldn't get them to work on any Windows 10 system, even with Android emulation. Or iPad. Definitely go for it if you'll only need them for a phone they are amazing. You will need to carefully choose the correct ear pieces or they will sound tinny and noise cancelling won't work - I suspect that is the cause behind many of the negative reviews.
customer_reviews.author: MWD88

customer_reviews.title: Great until they FALL OUT!
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation feature isn’t as good as I’d been led to believe - it well but only in certain environments. The app is decent. The case is decent. They’re relatively stylish. My biggest disappoint: They Don’t Stay In Your Ear! I can’t get them to stay in for more than a minute or two, you start to feel them fall out. I’ve tried changing the tips too :( I like the product but it’s turned out to be a bad purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Incredible audio
customer_reviews.text: The people who say noise islolation doesn’t work aren’t working headphones properly, they have ambient noise on. Hands down the most incredible piece of technology I have ever had. My iPhone 11 pro came the same day and I was simply obsessed with these headphones. If you get them get the app and turn off ambient noise, this is the Source of the only bad reviews. If you turn it off completely (which improves battery life) they will honestly blow your mind. Sound quality is 10/10, fit 9/10 (for me 10/10 however my dad has small ear canals and wouldn’t fit). Overall an incredible audio experience and matches my seinnheiser hd25s in everything apart from volume.
customer_reviews.author: rj self

customer_reviews.title: Don't fit in ears well
customer_reviews.text: Harsh to give 1 star as the sound quality is excellent. I've owned and tried a lot of in ear headphones, these just won't stay in, so just unusable. And now as I've stuck them in my ear, i can't return.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality but has its issues, refuses to play music sometimes when you take them out of your ears and put them back in and can be very temperamental with fitting inside your ear. When you get a decent fit the sound quality is amazing but fitting is key
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Only buy if you don’t intend to wear out and about!!!
customer_reviews.text: Item returned - the sound quality is amazing, the build is great and here comes the but...... left hand side unit is the primary Bluetooth receiver which means the right hand side unit is prone to dropping out. Had them switched to the stability setting, a lot better but still not perfect. This would happen to me several times a day, which is very frustrating. Mostly walking through London Bridge station, but also in the street, on the platform and on the train. The noise cancelling wasn’t the best when you're not playing music. A lot of sounds can be heard. These buds would be amazing if these issue were fixed
customer_reviews.author: Davvyj

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Bose over ear headphones which work fine but are bulky to carry and after wearing a period of time I find them uncomfortable. Decided on an upgrade to the Sony XM3 and cannot fault then in any way. Perfect fit, intuitive, easy to set up with a great sound. I use an iPad and Sony Walkman which provides HR sound so the combination is perfect. Bought a protective cover for the case.
customer_reviews.author: D. Eves

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, can be tricky to fit, noise cancelling good inside.
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation not so good against the wind. You have to get a really good fit for the sound cancelling to really work. It's hard to get a good fit, it seems the bigger ones will slip out but the smaller ones will kinda knock themselves out while eating or walking. Otherwise the noise cancelling is really good in the office for example. The sound is great, and the battery life is pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: Summit

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless earphones to date
customer_reviews.text: Really nice comfortable fit and well deserving high marks in magazine reviews. New firmware now has volume control which was missing when they first came out. Install the right tips for your ears and they sound fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Solipsis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound quality and noise cancellation. Fit needs some fiddling.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound, great noise cancellation for such a small set of headphones. Only criticisms are the charging case is quite bulky, and I struggled with the fit to get them to stay in my ears. In the end I used a set of silicon tips from my set of Beats X headphones and much more comfortable and secure now. Maybe I just have weird shaped ears The supplied app (in my case android) is excellent. Some people have complained about lack of volume but no such issues for me. I'm using with a Galaxy note 5g plus. Overall, excellent and very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Downer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality earphone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality and noise cancelling ability. It is rather to big for the ears. It does not fit very well into the ears, even when I changed to smaller ear plug that came with it. Will be better if the size could be reduced. The charging case is rather chunky. I also have the over the ear product. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Hummy15

customer_reviews.title: No aptx HD support.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent product, two criticisms, one minor one major. Minor : I would like to be able to say "alexa" to activate the alexa app and not have to touch the bud. Major : sound quality is only average due to no aptx HD support. Sony, you need to address the Bluetooth codec issue with a software upgrade. These aside, the buds are a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Mikeyevs

customer_reviews.title: I haven't heard any complaints
customer_reviews.text: The noise-cancelling is very effective; definitely the best I've tried. The price is, well, cheaper than the Well Known Brand that everybody's cross-shopping but on the other hand there are cheaper generics. Fit is OK; they're not going to fall out unless you do something quite dramatic. The little storage capsule (and charger) is well made and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: bobrayner

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up..
customer_reviews.text: Not a review addict, usually can't be bothered...but credit where it's due.. I thought my previous Sennheiser wired in-ear headphones were good (for the price paid) but these are on a different planet. I'm hearing things never heard before. I was waiting for the updated version of the Samsung Galaxy ear buds, but after reading reviews, I wasn't convinced so I took a punt on these Sony buds... So impressed... The box they come in is probably worth more than my old headphones.. I suppose they are a bit chunky compared to I-Phone buds, but having never listened to music through those, I can't comment... But right now... I'm in tune heaven.
customer_reviews.author: ADRIAN MOFFAT

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to achieve sound seal in ear
customer_reviews.text: Neat design and very good battery life. Sound quality pretty good, although because none of the tips seem to provide a good seal in my left ear, it's difficult to comment on the noise cancelling function. I can't be the only person with wide ear canals! Disappointing that the volume can only be controlled via the sound generating device or the app on your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sound, no noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: I expected better from these. Noise cancellation seems non-existent, but sound quality is good. Use the app to put the volume control onto one of the buds. It isn't obvious how to use these with stand alone music players, as everything is geared up to doing it all via the app, but I eventually figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Duh

customer_reviews.title: Not what they are made up to be.
customer_reviews.text: Wrongly marketed product. Touted as the best in noise cancellation, unfortunately they are at best average. If you plan to use them with an iPhone, I’d think twice. They take too long to connect, they disconnect and never reconnect when you need them to. Their 360 reality sound is great on paper however there are hardly any songs available that support this technology and therefore the feature becomes redundant. As a product, they aren’t terrible but I’d think twice before switching to them.
customer_reviews.author: Soham Shah

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding
customer_reviews.text: Brought this as a gift for my cousin and she loves it. Arrived the next day but it was faulty where she could not hear in one of the buds. Emailed tye seller for a replacement and the item came within 2 days. I packaged the faulty item up and had around 3 weeks to back postage free to a certain amount. Was very happy and overall a good customer experience
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing in everything. Just one con: doesn't work on Windows
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality amazing. Noise cancellation better than any other. You don't hear anything else if you have it active and are listening to music. It's even dangerous because if you are walking in the streets you won't be able to hear cars or anything else. Completely comfortable. You won't even realize that you are wearing them. Battery life longer than any other. Never cuts connection if you have Bluetooth 5.0 Cons: Windows still doesn't work even after update them. Wind sounds a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Adrián

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds sound superb. Great depth of bass and nicely controlled mid and upper range so they don't sound shrill. Alexa built in if you're into that. Plenty loud enough and noise cancellation seems fine. Neat little charge case as well with USB-c connection. Plenty of sizes of ear fittings as well. Only downside is you can't control the volume from them unless I'm missing something that is.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: If you like your sound loud. Download a sound boosting app.
customer_reviews.text: The sound of these sony earpuds are amazing. The sound coming out might be enough for some. But if your like me and you like your music loud you can lookup sound boosting apps on Google that do just that. The sound has become more punchy and these earbuds handle it fantastically They are comfortable. Sorry to hear some are saying otherwise. Brought these on amazon. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably good
customer_reviews.text: Everything I hoped for to be honest. Once I got a good fit, the noise cancelling on these in ear wireless speakers are truly excellent. Bass is incredible, and clarity of music I listen to is superb. I use tidal for my music and the lossless format along with these excellent in ear buds sound fantastic. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless earpieces
customer_reviews.text: Very sleek, professional looking. IMO better looking than the apple ones. Amazing sound quality. Only issue is with the noise cancelling during wind - it doesn't work as well compared to it's big brother the WH1000XM3 and tends to pick up some howling noises. But turning off noise cancelling and just using isolation works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: DZ2000

customer_reviews.title: Switching from Airpods
customer_reviews.text: I was at first worried that it may not work well with my iPhone but turned out to be no problem at all. Way better sound quality and handling. Also the quality of Noise cancellation is actually great for the earbuds!
customer_reviews.author: john doe

customer_reviews.title: For their size they pack a punch
customer_reviews.text: The sound isolation is good, the noise suppression is as good as you'd expect and the sound quality is top notch. The units can be controlled by touch or by app on the phone. Either way, they work well. They're stored in a small container that charges them when not in use. In all, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dutchy

customer_reviews.title: Good if you're sat still. Sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: They sound great under perfect conditions but I struggle to walk in them as the fit is so poor. The shape/weight makes it feel like they're going to fall out possibly at any minute. It's not like they will it just feels like they will. The noise cancelling is so poor I sometimes have to check the app to make sure it's on. I have XM3 headphones and people say it's close to that for NC but it's nowhere near for me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Sony wf 1000xm3 pricey but nice
customer_reviews.text: Received these today great surprise as thought they were turning up tomorrow does help if you have the app downloaded set up only took a few minutes the sound is great and the noise cancelling works well can be switched off they felt a bit strange at first thought they where going to fall out but shook head and they sat there fine. Charging case uses a usb c connection lead a bit short so ordered a couple of longer ones always handy to have a spare overall well pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: A Sells

product_meta.title: Sony WF-1000XM3 Truly Wireless Noise Cancelling Headphones with Mic, up to 32 Hours Battery Life, Stable Bluetooth Connection, Wearing Detection with Alexa Built-in - Black
product_meta.description: Colour Name:Black| Style Name:SingleIntroducing the Sony WF-1000XM3 premium wireless noise cancelling headphones. Sony has taken the industry leading QN1 noise cancelling processor from their award winning WH-1000XM3 and updated it to a new QN1e, to produce the new WF 1000XM3. The brand new QN1e processor boosts the range of frequencies from which noise-cancellation occurs, giving you full control over the sounds you want to block out whilst listening to your music. That means it's never been easier to take the bustle out of travel and immerse yourself in sound. On top of that, the WF1000XM3 comes with Adaptive Sound Control to optimise listening settings automatically based on your behaviour and environment. The earbuds last for up to 8 hours on a single charge when not using noise cancellation, or 6 hours with noise cancellation. They come with a stylish portable carrying case, which will protect the earbuds when you’re on the move and give an additional three charges And if you’re in a hurry, you can get 90 minutes’ use after just 10 minutes of charge. With the latest in Bluetooth technology, the WF1000XM3 can connect each earbud to your device individually. This allows for a more stable connection, with a faster response time meaning that your audio will sync perfectly with what you see on your device. Perfect for watching the latest show on your daily commute. Sony recommends you always update your devices with their latest available software. Software update notifications for WF-1000XM3, and the updates themselves, are delivered via the Sony Headphones Connect app, available free of charge on the Google Play and Apple App Store.
feature_bullets: Industry-leading noise cancellation* to block out unnecessary ambient noise (*As of June 1st 2019. According to research by Sony Corporation, measured using JEITA-compliant guidelines in Truly Wireless style noise cancelling headphones market)
Up to 8H battery life per single charge + additional 3 charges from carrying case
Ergonomic Tri-hold Structure for secure fitting
Alexa built-in devices let you instantly connect to Alexa to play music, control your smart home, get information, news, weather, and more using just your voice.

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
specifications.Customer reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
